intro: Vulvaria botrys, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Vulvaria botrys is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
